articles.title: WHO warn of further worldwide spread of Monkeypox - Highland Radio
articles.description: The World Health Organisation’s warning of a further rise in Monkeypox cases. It says 80 have now been confirmed across 11 countries, with a further 50 being investigated in Europe. The infection was first identified in monkeys and up to now had rarely spread…

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Russia confirms it has stopped gas exports to Finland for failing to pay in roubles - ABC News
articles.description: Gazprom demands European countries pay for Russian gas supplies in roubles because of sanctions imposed over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine, but Finland refuses to do so.
articles.content:
Russia's Gazprom has halted gas exports to neighbouring Finland, confirming what Finnish system operator Gasgrid Finland said earlier.
<ul><li>Gazprom said it had "completely stopped gas deliveries"… [+1344 chars]

articles.title: WHO calls emergency meeting as monkeypox cases top 100 in Europe - TODAY
articles.description: LONDON :     The World Health Organization was holding an emergency meeting on Friday to discuss the recent outbreak of monkeypox, a viral infection more common to west and central Africa, after over 100 cases were confirmed or suspected in Europe.   In what …

articles.title: Monkeypox: WHO emergency meeting amid ‘largest outbreak ever’ of disease in Europe - Evening Standard
articles.description: The World Health Organization was due to hold an emergency meeting on Friday to discuss the  monkeypox outbreak after more than 100 cases were confirmed or suspected in Europe.
articles.content:

articles.author: Mariam Ileyemi
articles.title: Monkeypox: UK deploys smallpox vaccines as cases spread in Europe - Premium Times
articles.description: As of Friday morning, the confirmed infections in the UK doubled to 20, while Portugal and Spain logged 14 and seven cases respectively.
articles.content:
The government of the United Kingdom has offered smallpox vaccines as a remedy for monkeypoxinfection, as more cases were confirmed in parts of Europe.
The UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) said the… [+2513 chars]

articles.title: Finland says Russia suspending natural gas supplies - World News - Castanet.net
articles.description: Russia will cut off natural gas to Finland after the Nordic country that applied for NATO membership this week refused President Vladimir Putin's demand to pay in rubles, the Finnish state-owned energy company said Friday, the latest escalation over European …
